intro: Phymatidium cundinamarcae, commonly known as the Cundinamarca phymatidium, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes mountains in Colombia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. Its small, white flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
